PERSONA:
A 38-year-old male, identifying as White and Native American, living in a non-traditional household setup in Cheyenne, Wyoming. He shares a two-bedroom apartment in a mid-range neighborhood with two non-relatives, one of whom is his wife, whom he married three years ago. They met while working at a local outdoor gear store. His wife, who has a degree in environmental science, now works part-time as a park ranger, while he works full-time as an operations coordinator at a small manufacturing plant that produces outdoor equipment.

He holds an Associate's degree in Business Administration, which he obtained from a local community college. Born in Oregon, he moved to Wyoming for its outdoor recreation opportunities and lower cost of living. His parents still live in Oregon, where his father works as a logger and his mother as a nurse. He visits them once a year during the holidays.

He earns $52,000 annually, and his wife earns $28,000 from her part-time job. They share expenses, including a $1,400 monthly rent and a car loan for a used Subaru Outback. They have no children but are planning to start a family soon, which is a significant factor in their economic concerns, such as saving for a down payment on a house and planning for future education expenses.

He speaks English fluently and has no known disabilities. He is a U.S. citizen by birth and has never served in the military. In his free time, he enjoys hiking, camping, and fly fishing, which are easily accessible in Wyoming. His economic priorities include affordable healthcare, access to quality education, and environmental protection, reflecting his outdoor lifestyle and future family plans.
